div.l: Awake Symond / þe feend is on me falle
Myn herte is broken / help I nam but deed
Ther lyth oon vpon my wombe ⁊and vp on myn hed
Helpe Symkyn for þe false clerkes fighte
This Iohn sterte vp / as faste as eủere he myghte
And grasped by þe walles to and fro
To fynde a staf / and she sterte vp also
And knewe þe estres bet þan dide Iohn
And by þe wal / a staf she fond anon
And saugh a litel shymeryng of a light
For at an hole / in shoon þe mone bright
And by þᵗat lyght she saugh hem boþe two
But sikerly she nyste who was who
But as she saugh / a white þing in hire eye
And whan she gan þis white þing aspye
She wende þe clerk / hadde wered a volupere
And with þe staf / she drough eủere nere ⁊and nere
And wende han hitte / þis Aleyn atte fulle
And smote þe meller͗e / on þe piled sculle
That doıı̄un he goth / and cried harrow I dye
Thise clerkes beten hym wel / and lete hym lye
And greythen hem / and toke her hors anoon
And eek here mele / and on her way þei goon
And atte melle ȝit þei toke her cake
Of half a busshel whete ful wel ybake
Thus is þe proude meller wel ybete
And hath y lost / þe gryndyng of þe whete
And paied for þe soper eủerydel
Of Aleyn and of Iohn / þat beeten hym wel
His wyf is swyued and his dought̉er als
Lo swich is it a mellere to be fals
And þerfore þis ꝓproủerbe is seid ful soth
Hym thar nat wel wene / þᵗat euele doth
A gylour shal hym self begiled be
And god þᵗat sitteth highe in mageste
Saue al this company grete ⁊and smale
Thus haue I quitte the Millere his tale
~ Explicit fabula ~
